meanings.definition: The act of inciting or stirring up
meanings.sent1: The incitation of the crowd led to chaos in the streets.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was an incitation to rebellion against the unjust ruler.
meanings.sent3: The incitation of the puppies to play resulted in a mess of torn toys.
meanings.sent4: The incitation of the storm brought destruction to the small town.
meanings.sent5: The incitation of fear spread through the village like wildfire.

meanings.sent1: The fiery speech was an incitation to revolution.
meanings.sent2: The painting served as an incitation for deep contemplation.
meanings.sent3: The incitation of the delicious aroma made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The incitation of the music inspired a wave of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The incitation of the bright colors caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To incite or provoke someone to action
meanings.sent1: The leader tried to incitation the people to stand up for their rights.
meanings.sent2: Her passionate speech incitationed the audience to join the cause.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child incitationed the dog to chase its tail.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work incitationed a new wave of creativity in the community.
meanings.sent5: The coach incitationed the team to give their all in the final game.
